etymology.description: semantic: 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 羊(羊) (yáng, "goat") = sound element referring to fluidity like a river -> river
etymology.interpretation: The character 羕(羕) (yàng, "river") combines 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") emphasizing the semantic aspect of flowing water, with 羊(羊) (yáng), serving as a phonetic component. This phono-semantic combination effectively conveys the sense of a river.

examples.english: The river has flowed since ancient times.

examples.chinese: 远处见羕水(遠處見羕水)，两岸花开(兩岸花開)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎn chù jiàn yàng shuǐ, liǎng àn huā kāi.
examples.english: In the distance, one can see the river, and flowers bloom on both banks.
